A Song of degrees. Many a time have they afflicted me from my youth, may Israel now say:<RF>Many…: or, Much<Rf>
Many a time have they afflicted me from my youth: yet they have not prevailed against me.<RF>Many…: or, Much<Rf>
The plowers plowed upon my back: they made long their furrows.
The LORD <FI>is<Fi> righteous: he hath cut asunder the cords of the wicked.<CM>
Let them all be confounded and turned back that hate Zion.
Let them be as the grass <FI>upon<Fi> the housetops, which withereth afore it groweth up:
Wherewith the mower filleth not his hand; nor he that bindeth sheaves his bosom.
Neither do they which go by say, The blessing of the LORD <FI>be<Fi> upon you: we bless you in the name of the LORD.<CM>
